image.altText: A yellow rescue helicopter sitting in snow.

props.synopsis: Police cite a series of "avoidable" rescues, including a family with a small child spending two nights "huddled together in blizzard conditions" during a plea for people to not underestimate the Tasmanian wilderness ahead of a cold snap.

title.children: Family's nightmare in blizzard conditions cited in plea to bushwalkers

image.altText: Artist impression of AFL match underway at proposed Macquarie Point stadium

props.synopsis: After raising "significant concerns" about the proposed Hobart stadium's roof design, cricket authorities have now signed an agreement with the Tasmanian premier to find a solution for the sport to play there.

title.children: New hope for cricket at Macquarie Point after agreement on stadium roof

image.altText: A woman wearing glasses holding up a children's book.

props.synopsis: When Jayne Case and her family ended up having to spend weeks in the neonatal intensive care unit she couldn't find a book to help her young boys navigate the journey, so she wrote one.

title.children: Siblings of NICU babies at the core of storybook to understand journey

image.altText: A woman in a red dress and young  adult in a collared shirt standing on a beach

props.synopsis: The success stories of the NDIS "are now at risk", health providers and their regional clients warn, ahead of travel allowance payments being cut in half from next week.

title.children: 'Don't take that away from us': Mother warns of NDIS travel cuts for therapists

image.altText: Thumbnail image for Tasmania state election 2025 promise tracker article.

props.synopsis: As Tasmanians prepare for a July 19 vote, we keep track of each party's election promises on everything from health and housing to the stadium.

title.children: Childcare, streamlining approvals and all the other election promises

image.altText: A man and woman stand grouped in a selfie with their two young children, one girl and one boy, all smiling.

props.synopsis: Celebrities like Miley Cyrus are speaking about the benefits of eye movement desensitisation and reprocessing (EMDR) therapy. But what is EMDR and its role in psychological treatment?

title.children: When Samuel's mum died, he didn't expect EMDR to be his 'circuit breaker'

image.altText: A man and a woman inside a camper van.

props.synopsis: Northern Territory police have announced a new $500,000 reward for information that leads to the discovery of Peter Falconio's body, more than 20 years after his murder.

title.children: Police offer $500k reward in bid to find Peter Falconio's remains

image.altText: Sussan stands at a lectern wearing a black blazer and open-necked white shirt.

props.synopsis: Sussan Ley speaks at the National Press Club for the first time as Liberal leader, saying she is prepared to be a "zealot" to get more women preselected in winnable seats. Follow live.

title.children: 'Zealot' Ley puts Liberals on notice to preselect more women

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Ley's plans for the teal seats
Ley's message to Libs on preselecting women
Ley kicks off address to the NPC

image.altText: A digital drawing of Erin Patterson wearing a pink shirt

props.synopsis: Justice Christopher Beale's directions to the jury in Ms Patterson's triple-murder trial enter their second day at the Latrobe Valley Law Courts in the regional Victorian town of Morwell.

title.children: Judge in Erin Patterson trial continues final instructions to jury

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Some other directions given to the jury yesterday
Direction on expert evidence to continue

image.altText: Group picture of NATO leaders and Dutch royals

props.synopsis: With the US president jetting into the Hague for the NATO summit, it appeared European leaders were pulling out all the stops to win over Donald Trump's favour. Here are the key takeaways from day one at the event.

title.children: NATO aims to flatter, but Trump remains unpredictable

image.altText: Virgin Australia signs on a window, with ASX boards behind

props.synopsis: Virgin has undergone some radical surgery in the five years since it collapsed, and soared on its ASX re-entry, but the risks of investing in airlines remain.

title.children: Virgin boss dodges a disaster to bring the airline home

image.altText: Gout Gout sticks his tongue out and points while holding flowers.

props.synopsis: Australian sprint superstar Gout Gout breaks his own national 200m record in his first international senior meet.

title.children: Gout Gout follows in Usain Bolt's footsteps in his international debut

image.altText: Julie Inman Grant 4 analysis

props.synopsis: With so many questions about how this ban will work it might be time for the government to clear a runway for a temporary landing.

title.children: Unwieldy social media ban poses a prickly problem for Labor

image.altText: A red sold sticker across a for sale sign outside a house with a large front yard on a sunny day

props.synopsis: More borrowers are falling behind on mortgage repayments, but experts say numbers are overall low and expected to fall further, with rate cuts expected.

title.children: Strain of interest rates hitting home loan borrowers but relief in sight

image.altText: Oil rig in California

props.synopsis: The ASX is fairly flat in early trade despite US stocks jumping overnight as the shaky Israel-Iran ceasefire appeared to hold. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX misses out on share surge as oil plunges on Israel-Iran ceasefire

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX flat, AUD rises at midday
ASX edges higher as commodity producers weigh on the market

image.altText: Cars on snowy ground

props.synopsis: The snowy Wednesday will follow the passage of powerful cold fronts, which are also delivering much needed rain, along with small hail and thunderstorms.

title.children: South-eastern Australia set for an icy soaking, with snowfall forecast

image.altText: A person holds a mobile phone in their hand with the screen open to a digital licence with driver's photograph.

props.synopsis: Cybersecurity specialists warn a "very cheap coding trick" is being spruiked as a high-tech anti-fraud measure on digital drivers licences.

title.children: Digital drivers licence anti-fraud technology only a 'cheap coding trick'

image.altText: Childcare

props.synopsis: It seems without deeper reform the childcare system will continue to bleed public money while failing the children it's meant to serve.

title.children: Damning report reveals childcare subsidy has leaked $2.6b

image.altText: Two bears in an enclosure

props.synopsis: After helping themselves to a "selection of snacks", the bears eventually returned to their enclosure and fell asleep.

title.children: Two brown bears escape enclosure and eat week's worth of honey

image.altText: Two men deliver budget speech

props.synopsis: In uncertain times, hope is the takeaway in the budget handed down on Tuesday by Queensland's newly minted Treasurer David Janetzki, writes Matt Eaton.

title.children: Hope springs eternal in Queensland's ambitious budget

image.altText: A full street with people marching with flags and signs, one says: liberation freedom restitution.

props.synopsis: National leaders, experts and community voices on First Nations justice will meet in Alice Springs from today, as pressure grows on the federal government to play a greater role in youth justice.

title.children: First Nations leaders meet in Alice Springs to address incarceration crisis

image.altText: Xiaozheng Lin stands against a grey backdrop in a police mug shot.

props.synopsis: The Victorian Director of Public Prosecutions is appealing against the 14-year prison sentence Xiaozheng Lin received after pleading guilty to the manslaughter of two women in their homes in a 24-hour period in Melbourne in 2022.

title.children: Killer's sentence sends 'chilling message', sex worker advocate says

image.altText: A red ant-like wasp with thin wings, curly antennae all against a salty yellowed white crystal background.

props.synopsis: An eyeless wasp is just one of several new cave-dwelling invertebrates discovered within the proposed boundary of a massive renewable energy project.

title.children: Hand-sized spiders and world-first eyeless wasp discovered under Nullarbor

image.altText: Two men stand beside each other on a farm.

props.synopsis: This farming family has millions in super but proposed reforms have left them in a position where they may have to sell the farm.

title.children: Super changes will hit those with millions but they say the impact could be devastating

image.altText: A woman with black hair and an older man with no hair, wearing formal attire on a red carpet.

props.synopsis: The wedding party of the billionaire Amazon founder and his journalist fiancee Lauren Sanchez has been moved after weeks of protests against plans to transform Venice into a "private amusement park".

title.children: Jeff Bezos forced to move wedding after protests in Venice

image.altText: A sketch of Sean Diddy Combs at his trial

props.synopsis: The music mogul's defence team has decided not to present its own witnesses, with Sean "Diddy" Combs saying, "that is my decision" not to testify.

title.children: Sean 'Diddy' Combs declines to take the stand in sex trafficking trial

image.altText: A young woman looking confused, starting at her phone while sitting at a desk

props.synopsis: Superannuation can seem like a set-and-forget prospect. But how often should you be checking your account and what should you be looking for?

title.children: Why it is important to check your super account regularly

image.altText: Faith Kipyegon smiles and holds a flag

props.synopsis: Faith Kipyegon will attempt to break the magical 4-minute barrier for the mile in a specially organised attempt at the Stade Charléty in Paris. But is it even possible?

title.children: An engineered suit, 3D-printed bra and 85g spikes: How to chase a 4-minute mile

image.altText: A bat with wings fully stretched by human hands.

props.synopsis: While there are plenty of conservation efforts and community love for cute marsupials like the western ringtail possum, researchers say that pretty privilege is threatening the existence of blood suckers and web weavers.

title.children: Ugly endangered animals ignored as 'cute' bias harms conservation efforts

image.altText: A young girl crying with her family behind her.

props.synopsis: More violence has erupted at an aid distribution centre in the Palestinian enclave as fighting between Israel and Hamas has continued.

title.children: At least 40 Palestinians killed in single day as Gaza fighting continues

image.altText: A group of roller derby players in the midst of training in a large velodrome.

props.synopsis: The Sydney Roller Derby League abides by one of the most progressive gender policies in world sport. For people like Commando, it has meant they have been able to "return home".

title.children: With trans participation under threat, fringe sports are bucking the trend
